alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 12:46PM MDT until August 13 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Wayne County in southern Utah...Specifically for northern portions of Capitol Reef National Park... * Until 345 PM MDT. * At 1246 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Sulphur Creek and the upper headwaters of Grand Wash. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks, washes and slot canyons. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and slot canyons can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, normally dry washes, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams, normally dry washes, or creeks.
